test_cases.name: Successful Login and Creation of a Basic Task Assigned to a Single User
preconditions: The test environment and application server must be stable and accessible.
A valid user account with appropriate permissions exists.
The specified company is associated with the user account.
The team member to be assigned exists in the target company.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application base URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page loads successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid email address.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is correctly entered into the email input field.

test_steps.action: Click the Continue button.
test_steps.expected_result: The application proceeds to the password entry screen.

test_steps.action: Enter the corresponding valid password.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is entered into the password field.

test_steps.action: Click the Login button.
test_steps.expected_result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the company selection page.

test_steps.action: Wait for the company selection page and click on the correct company name.
test_steps.expected_result: The company is selected and the user is navigated to the application dashboard.

test_steps.action: From the dashboard, click on the 'Action Items' menu.
test_steps.expected_result: A submenu with options appears.

test_steps.action: Click on the 'Tasks' submenu option.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format and press ENTER.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is accepted and displayed in the date field.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' field, enter a single, valid user email.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears showing matching users.

test_steps.action: Click the matching user from the autocomplete dropdown to select them.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected user is added to the assignment list for the task.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The form is submitted and the task creation process is initiated.

test_steps.action: Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
test_steps.expected_result: The application returns to the Manage Tasks page, confirmed by the visibility of the 'New Task' button.

test_cases.name: Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Users' Bulk Assignment
preconditions: User is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.
The test environment and application server are stable.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format and press ENTER.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is accepted and displayed in the date field.

test_steps.action: Scroll down and locate the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is visible.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The checkbox is successfully selected.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created and saved without errors.

test_steps.action: Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
test_steps.expected_result: The application returns to the Manage Tasks page after task creation.

test_cases.name: Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Admins' and Optional Alignments
preconditions: User is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.
A Priority with a known name exists in the system.
A Huddle with a known name exists in the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Due_Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format and press ENTER.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is accepted and displayed in the date field.

test_steps.action: Scroll down and click the 'Assign to all Admins' checkbox to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Assign to all Admins' checkbox is successfully selected.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the Priority alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The input field is focused.

test_steps.action: Enter the name of a pre-existing Priority.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown appears with matching Priorities.

test_steps.action: Click the matching Priority from the dropdown to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified Priority is successfully selected and aligned.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the Huddle alignment section and click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The input field is focused.

test_steps.action: Enter the name of a pre-existing Huddle.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown appears with matching Huddles.

test_steps.action: Click the matching Huddle from the dropdown to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified Huddle is successfully selected and aligned.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully with all specified assignments and alignments.

test_cases.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'File' Type Document Attachment
preconditions: User is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.
The specified file for upload exists at the configured base path on the test execution machine.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
test_steps.expected_result: Task name and due date are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Scroll down to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens successfully.

test_steps.action: In the document upload dialog, enter the 'Document Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Document_Description'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document description is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Ensure the document type is 'File'.
test_steps.expected_result: 'File' is the selected document type.

test_steps.action: Locate the hidden file input, make it visible, and send the full path to an existing local file.
test_steps.expected_result: The file path is sent to the input element and the upload process begins.

test_steps.action: Wait for the file upload to complete.
test_steps.expected_result: A confirmation indicates the file has been uploaded.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The dialog closes and the document appears as attached to the task.

test_steps.action: Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created with the document attached, and the application returns to the Manage Tasks page.

test_cases.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'Link' Type Document Attachment
preconditions: User is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page.

test_data.Document_Description: Link to the main project documentation page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid 'Short Task Name' and 'Due_Date'.
test_steps.expected_result: Task name and due date are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Scroll down to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens successfully.

test_steps.action: In the document upload dialog, enter the 'Document Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Document_Description'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document description is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Link' document type is selected, and a URL input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid URL in the 'Enter Link...' field.
test_steps.expected_result: The URL is accepted by the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The dialog closes and the document link appears as attached to the task.

test_steps.action: Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created with the document link attached, and the application returns to the Manage Tasks page.

test_cases.name: Successful Data-Driven Creation of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
preconditions: The test environment and application server must be stable and accessible.
An Excel file containing at least two distinct, valid task definitions is available.
The first row of the Excel file contains valid login credentials and company name.
All users, Priorities, and Huddles specified in the Excel file pre-exist in the system.

test_data.note: This test case uses a data source (e.g., Excel) with multiple rows.

test_steps.action: Execute the full login, company selection, and navigation to the Tasks page using data from the first task row.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is logged in and the Manage Tasks page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Create the first task according to its data from the first row.
test_steps.expected_result: The first task is created successfully, and the application returns to the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Verify the application is still on the Manage Tasks page.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' button is visible, confirming the user session is active and on the correct page.

test_steps.action: Create the second task according to its data from the second row without re-logging in.
test_steps.expected_result: The second task is created successfully in the same session, and the application returns to the Manage Tasks page.

test_steps.action: Continue this process for all subsequent rows in the Excel file.
test_steps.expected_result: Each task defined in the Excel file is created successfully in sequence without session errors.

test_steps.action: After the last task is created, close the browser.
test_steps.expected_result: The test completes successfully.
